project_name: UPM-Re-Configuration of Ladies Toilet Pipework MP14
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Brando Dooley DDS (2):offer submitted by Brando Dooley DDS (3):work in progress by Brando Dooley DDS

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Historically the accessibility and ladies toilets have blocked and back filled causing the toilet to be closed off until the blockage is cleared. On investigation there is not sufficient drop on the waste pipe to drain away.
scope_of_work.scope:
Contractor to set up safe working area as necessary
Isolate supplies
Remove IPS panels and set aside for re-use
Alter all pipework and replace parts accordingly to allow for correct falls
Clean up debris from site
Re-instate IPS as necessary
Re-instate supplies
Remove safe working area.
scope_of_work.justification: To allow full use of the accessibility and ladies toilets without having to take the block of toilets out of use.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Toilets will continue to block causing regular closures.

scope_of_work.problem: There is insufficient white space data infrastructure in place for additional services required.
scope_of_work.scope:
1.	CBRE to provide access the external Vodafone/fibre chambers for Vodafone to carry out a new IBM circuit rod and rope pre-install activity. 
2.	IBM LAN room (DGB / 5G26) work:
a.	Right-side power pole in rack DGB02 isn’t working – fix this power pole and test power poles in the other racks and fix any more faults found.
b.	Install three new intra-rack cables between racks DGB02 & DGB05 and label in line with the intra rack standard. Following on from what’s installed today - the label at rack DGB02 end should read DGB020525 and from DGB05 it should read DGB050225 etc.
3.	When migration to a new IBM network occurs:
a.	Engage WatchPass for IBM Security device IP updates.
b.	Support with IBM printer & Voice testing.
scope_of_work.justification: This will provide the additional infrastructure required.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: The additional services will not be able to be supplied.

project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick PH1 Fuel Pipeline Replacement
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Miss Maymie Sporer

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: We have an issue on our PH1 Fuel Pipeline Distribution line. The pipe in pipe system that feeds up and over the service road has a leak within the bunded area that is preventing us being able to fill our PH1 Generator Day Tanks
scope_of_work.scope:
Specialist Contractor to attend site under supervision of CBRE to complete the works
Works will go ahead as follows:
- Supply and install scaffolding to allow access to fuel pipeline
- Remove redundant pipework from within the bunded area
- Supply and Connect new pipework 
- Test system to ensure all in working order
- Complete after works report
scope_of_work.justification: If this issue is not funded/resolved then we are unable to fill the day tanks within PH1. If we were to have a prolonged mains utility outage would be unable to refill the tanks leaving us vulnerable. The critical load supplied from these generator sets would be lost if we were to run out of fuel.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: The PH1 Generator Day Tanks will not be able to be refilled with this issue which leaves us vulnerable if fuel refill is required during prolonged generator runs

project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick Cabling for WAPS in MP13 to LAN Room 1G2
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Miss Maymie Sporer

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: CIO have requested 2 x Cat6A SFTP Cable to be installed from LAN Room 1G2 to MP13 (Kyndryl Office Space) at the Warwick location. This is to allow for the separation of the network at Warwick between Kyndryl and IBM
scope_of_work.scope:
Supply and install 1 x 70mtrs Cat6a SFTP Cable from an agreed position within
MP13 to an existing Data Cabinet (TBC) located within LAN Room 1G2. Supply and install 1 x 90mtrs Cat6a SFTP Cable from an agreed position within MP13 to an existing Data Cabinet (TBC) located within LAN Room 1G2. The 2 x Cat6a SFTP Cable will be installed at High level and secured where possible onto the existing cable containment infrastructure along the cable route.

We have allowed 1 x Standard RJ45/C6A field plug termination at the WAP
module position for each cable

We have allowed 1 x Female C6A termination at the Patch Panel position for
each cable
scope_of_work.justification: If this work is not performed then the network at Warwick will not be able to be split between IBM & Kyndryl
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: CIO would not be able to complete their required tasks to split IBM from Kyndryl in regard to the network at the location

Warwick Nodes 307, 309, 310, 312, 313, 314

project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick Bulk Fuel Tank Fill
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Miss Maymie Sporer

scope_of_work.notes:
1. This includes a 10% contingency to allow for fuel price increase that will only be spent upon Kyndryl RDC Approval
2. CBRE will work alongside Kyndryl to detail spend on this works
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The location currently has enough fuel to provide 48 hours however our bulk tank still has the allowance for an additional 20,000 litres. As we are approaching a difficult period it has been requested to look at filling our Bulk Tank on site
scope_of_work.scope: Specialist Supplier to provide 20,000 litres of Fuel to Kyndryl Warwick. Fuel to be transported to the location and pumped into the BST 2 Tank within our critical plant area
scope_of_work.justification: If we were to have a prolonged outage on site it would assist with supporting the locations critical infrastructure for a longer period if the tanks are to be filled
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: We would have reduced time on what the site is capable of supplying if we were to run on Generators for prolonged periods
